SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
REBATE MANAGEMENT
Streamline Payout Calculations for Rebates

Use Data Processing Engine (DPE) definitions to transform data stored in various standard or custom objects in your org and to write back the results to a target object. Query, filter, and aggregate Transaction Journal records for rebate calculation. Choose the correct DPE definition for your use case. Clone and customize predefined definitions or create a definition, and then activate the definitions.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions that have Rebate Management enabled.
Data Processing Engine Templates with Rebate Management
Rebate Management has Data Processing Engine (DPE) templates that you can clone and customize. The templates either help you to aggregate transactions by different criteria, or help you to manage other rebate processes. Examples of processes are: converting order records into transaction journal records, validating ship-and-debit transactions, and calculating payouts at the parent-account level.
Clone the Data Processing Engine Templates
Clone the Data Processing Engine templates readily available with Rebate Management. When you clone a template, the cloned definition can be activated and used as the calculation definition in a rebate type for rebate processing. You can also choose to create a Data Processing Engine from scratch, and select the Process Type as Rebates.
Customize Data Processing Engine Definitions to Support a Large Number of Rebate Eligibility Conditions
Data Processing Engine (DPE) definition runs can fail if there are multiple eligibility criteria conditions to filter transactions that qualify for member payouts. Having a large number of filter conditions in a DPE definition increases the recipe size that’s not supported by the calculation engine framework. To reduce the chances of DPE failure, use the Compute Valid Transaction Journals Per Rebate Type custom node.
Create Custom Data Processing Engine Definitions
Create a Data Processing Engine definition from scratch if the predefined templates don’t meet your requirements.
Activate a Data Processing Engine Definition
Only active Data Processing Engine definitions can be used in a rebate type. The admin can clone and customize any of the predefined Data Processing Engine templates that come with Rebate Management, and activate the cloned definitions.
Group Rebate Payouts by Region and Aggregate by Member (Example)
A company wants to group and aggregate transaction data of rebate program members by region of sale. Program managers and sales managers want to track and reward members based on region-specific sales. Also, the benefits rolled out to the members vary by region. Region-based numbers give insight into the regions where the company can promote their products and increase their footprint. This example shows how you can achieve the aggregation.
Additional Learning Resources for Data Processing Engine
Learn more about how to best use Data Processing Engine (DPE).
